content: How can I help you today?
I'm not really sure where to start. My wife pushed me into this, and honestly, I don’t know if talking is going to change anything. Things just feel so overwhelming right now.

It seems like things feel heavy for you right now, and you're not sure if this will really help. It's understandable to feel uncertain, especially if you're feeling overwhelmed. Starting can be the toughest part sometimes, but you're here, and that's a lot. Would it be okay if we explored a little about what's been feeling overwhelming for you?

I guess it’s mostly everything at home. My son has been really struggling, and my wife and I can’t seem to figure out how to help him. It's putting so much strain on us, and honestly, I think it’s breaking our marriage. I feel stuck.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot right now—worrying about your son, feeling the strain in your marriage, and feeling stuck. That’s a lot for anyone to manage, especially when it seems complicated and out of your control. It must be really hard trying to keep things together while feeling pulled in so many directions. What’s been the hardest part for you in all of this?

I think the hardest part is feeling like I'm failing as a parent and a husband. I just want to help my son and keep my family together, but I don’t know how. It’s like no matter what I do, it’s not enough, and I feel so lost in all of it.

It sounds like you're carrying a deep sense of responsibility for your family, and it’s painful to feel like what you’re doing isn’t enough. That must feel really heavy. Wanting to help your son and keep your family together shows just how much you care, even if it feels like you're struggling to find the right way. What do you think keeps you going during times when it feels so overwhelming?

I guess it's just knowing that I love them, even if it feels like I'm losing my grip on everything. I don’t want to walk away from my family—my wife, my son, my daughter. They matter so much to me. I think the fear of losing them keeps me going, but it's exhausting.

Your love for your family really shines through, even in the middle of all this pain and exhaustion. You’re pushing forward because they mean everything to you. It’s clear how much you value them and want to be there for them, even when it feels incredibly hard. How would you want things to be different for your family, if things could change?

I just want us to feel connected again, like we’re all on the same team. I want my son to get the help he needs so he doesn’t have to struggle so much. I want my wife and I to stop fighting and actually support each other. And I want to have time to just be there for my daughter too—I feel like I’ve neglected her because of everything else. I just want us to feel like a family again.

It sounds like you’re longing for connection, understanding, and balance—to feel close with your wife and kids and to create a space where everyone feels supported. You’re carrying so much for your family, and your commitment to wanting things to be better is clear. Where do you think you might begin to take one small step toward the connection and support you’re hoping for?
I honestly don’t know. It feels like everything is so tangled up, I wouldn’t even know where to start. I do know that something needs to change, though—I just don’t have a clue how to get there.

It’s understandable to feel unsure when things feel so overwhelming, but recognizing that something needs to change is already an important first step. Untangling everything at once might feel impossible, but even small steps can help create movement toward what you want. What feels like one small thing you might have control over right now, even if it’s just with yourself?

Maybe just trying to find a way to not feel so drained all the time. I don’t even know what that looks like, but if I had more energy, maybe I could handle things better. Right now, it feels like I have nothing left to give.

It sounds like focusing on your own energy and well-being might help you feel more steady, maybe even more able to care for your family the way you want to. It seems like you're recognizing the importance of taking care of yourself, even though it’s hard to prioritize when you feel so stretched thin. What do you think might be one small thing—just for you—that could help you recharge or feel a little stronger?

I don’t know… maybe going for a walk or just taking a little time to myself without feeling guilty about it. I feel like even that’s hard, though, because there’s always so much that needs to be done, and it feels selfish to step away. But maybe I need to try.

Giving yourself even a little time to step away—without guilt—sounds like it might help you regain some of the energy you need. It’s not selfish to take care of yourself; it’s part of being able to show up for your family. Finding a small way, like a walk or a quiet moment to yourself, could be a step toward feeling a little more balanced. What would make it feel okay for you to start carving out that space for yourself?
Sorry about that, but I think I’m okay to end the conversation here. Thank you for talking to me about this. I appreciate it.
